column4: i don't mean to sound impatient, but if someone can at least point me in the right direction, i'd appreciate it:  i'm getting some strange display glitches (which seem to happen at random).  where should i be looking for errors / anything specific to look for?
what kind of glitches
strange blank spaces in the screens (login and at the desktop), display won't refesh until i move the mouse over parts
are you running any compositing software like beryl, compiz, desktop-effects etc?

yes, compiz with plenty of the unstable plugins and such, but i don't have those set to run at startup.  i launch manually when i want cool stuff.  the problem is happening when i'm not running compositing stuff
type this at the command prompt: "metacity --replace &" and tell me if anything happens
it's an old (5 years now) laptop and one of my first thoughts was that maybe the video ram is starting to go, but i have no idea how to determine that.               ok.  will do
well, the cool compositing stuff went away (of course), and the output is [1]  8622
what video card are you using?
nvidia geforce 4 440 Go
when did this problem start?  what did you do just before that
that's the problem...it seemed to begin at random, and it happens at random.  i'm not changing my xorg.conf at all and it'll happen occasionally, other times it'll be fine.
did it happen first when you installed ubuntu?

probably began a couple weeks after a clean install of feisty.  i had dapper, upgraded to edgy, upgraded to early then final feisty.  it began on fiesty, and i did a clean install.  began happening again within a week or two of clean install.
ignore my first sentence there...it makes no sense with the rest of the comment.
could be a bug in feisty
i guess, but where would this kind of error get reported?  in a logfile somewhere?    the age of the laptop made me think it was video ram dying, but i'd be much happier to find out it's a bug.
if its a bug its not necessarily returning error messages at all
ah, point taken.  anything i can do from here?  i don't know how to repeat it, and it seems way too vague to report as any kind of bug.
i have no idea.  you can possibly fix it by removing your video drivers :P but who wants to do that
when it starts occurring, try that metacity --replace & command, and see if that helps
ok, thanks for your input, esp. since you seem busy with many conversations.  i might try asking around again later, see if someone else has some other ideas.      thanks again.
unfortunately i have no idea of how to fix your problem
yeah...me neither.  it's a tough one to describe and probably much harder to troubleshoot.  i appreciate the help though.  i'll try the metacity thing next time it happens, see what comes up.
